alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith; Palo Duro Canyon; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 9:59AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Randall and southeastern Deaf Smith Counties through 1030 AM CDT... At 959 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southwest of Buffalo Lake, or 12 miles east of Hereford, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Hereford, Canyon, Mescalero Park, Buffalo Lake, Dawn, and Umbarger. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
